reviewText:
Early Access Review

** Key was provided by developer for review purposes	**

Super Dungeon Run
Super Dungeon Run is a fast paced, addicting game. In the game you control your greedy gold loving heroes fighting through dungeons, and dying to traps and enemies for a bit of loot. I will add a TL;DR at the end.

Gameplay/Controls
The controls are very simple as you use your mouse to guide you greedy heroes through the dungeon and use the 1, 2, and 3 keys to activate potions to help your heroes out.

The gameplay is very enjoyable. You start off with a set number of greedy peasants (you will know why I say greedy" after) and fight through a dungeon to collect loot. In the game you can accept quest with the first one being to steal back a watermelon. The dungeons consist of floors which are anywhere from 10 seconds to 3 minutes long. As you continue to play this game you will unlock more heroes
recommended: and more quests in which you will get your butt kicked a bit. A key thing to note is that the heroes are very
voteText: greedy. More than a couple times a few coins would be lying around
helpfulPercent: and my heroes would run to the coins getting themselves
votesHelpful:
and most of my other heroes killed because of their greed. If you go too far away from one hero they will no longer be part of your party and you will need to go back to get them.  In the game there are 7 different types of heroes (including peasants) and 4 different types of potion.

Graphics/Sound
The graphics are cartoony and seem a bit paper-like as of now. The area and village are rendered as a more 3D structure. The units are each unique in their design and very enjoyable to play. The music is done amazingly in this game. The music actually reminded me of an old game I used to play. Either way the music is very enjoyable.

Pros/Cons
Pros

+ Good music
+ Quick-paced
+ Simple
+ Quests are fun
+ Rewards you as you play and level up
+ Potions are fairly balanced
+ 7 different heroes and 4 different potions
+ Great art style

Cons

- Easy to lose a hero
- Slight grind
- Death is tasteless (they just flop over no matter what)

Suggestions
These are my personal suggestions for the game. My suggestions do not need to be taken seriously as they are my personal opinion for hopefully adding to the game to make it better.

- Controller Support
- Customization of heroes (different weapons and articles of clothing to choose from)

Final Thoughts
I have greatly enjoyed my time playing Super Dungeon Run. I have seen what the developer hopes to add and I am looking forward to it (especially funny deaths). The quests are nice and it was fun to play through this game. The only bad things that nudged at me was how easy it was to lose a hero
votesTotal:
and how the heroesâ€™ greed got me killed more than a few times. Overall I'm happy to have had the chance to play this early access game.

TL;DR
Super Dungeon Runner is fast-paced with floors in a dungeon ranging from 10 seconds to 3 minutes. The controls are simple as you only use your mouse and the 1
column17: and of course your little dungeon running heroes in this game (7 heroes and 4 potions). The heroes are a bit greedy sometimes getting themselves killed for some coins. You fight through dungeon
column21: and upgrade heroes as you level up. Truly fun and quick

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Super Dungeon Run is a simple one-button mouse dungeon rush with a lot of fun features, such as:

Variety of loot to collect.
Leveling yourself and also your heroes.
Craft new potions, units, items.
Main quest and side quests.
Talent tree.
Accessible price.
The game seems to be a little easy by now. But, hey, it's a early access game. Difficult and other things might change.

In general I'd recommend you to buy this game since this concept is awesome and I'm really looking forward for it's final version.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Would you dare vicious traps, monsters, and inevitable death all for some shiny loot and gold? Well the peasants in Super Dungeon Run would! SDR is a strange mash up of roguelike, endless runner and RPG. There are quests, upgrades, and plenty of randomly generated death rooms, and of course delicious amounts of treasure! As your peasants run and collect gold you will begin collecting upgrades in the form of potions and costumes. These allow your peasants to become much more extraordinary and wield incredible abilities, such as the Sorceroress or the mighty Knight. I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of replay value and depth SDR has for it's adorable simple graphics and gameplay. I wasn't expecting things like crafting, class upgrades and skill trees. Where things need more polish is in the dungeon running itself. Let me be clear, everything works very well while running, you unlock potions, classes and move your poor adventurers about in a hilarious drunken wave. The problem is there is a bit of lack of interaction when the action kicks in. You kinda just sit there and watch what happens. Using a potion occasionally to help your adventurers out of a jam. However, things like class abilities and spells are already planned for final release and will more then likely take care of this aspect. In all Super Dungeon Run for it's price is an absolute steal and highly recommended to those looking for a funny and relaxing roguelike.

I made a video preview to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!
https://youtu.be/uuA-r8oMOMM
I hope you enjoy!
Martyr

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Super Dungeon Run is a Hack & Slash / RPG Dungeon Video Game.

It's a basic dungeon Run game that has some really nice upgrades systems to it.
Funny game with not a good and big story mode.
It plays very well and it will give you as a gamer very hard challenge keeping your group together between dungeon runs..
Really fun and frustrating game to play and give you many hours of fun.
What really dissapoints me the most is a support for a controller because I think playing this game with a controller makes it much better playable.
There are no steam cards so there is no badge to be made :(

It's still a early acces when I played and made my review so some thing hope to changed on the way.
Fun game and with some changes this can be a great game so keep on the good work Devs.

For now I give it a 6/10 score.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game after i saw a video of it online and i love it. Altough i think its great it still has some downsides i want to list.

- not enough upgrades (5 upgrades per character)
- upgrades not visible (would be cool to see some changes to the characters after upgrading)
- the resource balance is broken (the first 20 lvls you are always hurting for something after that you have tons of that     stuff and cant even spent it)
- you are somewhat forced to do the same dungeon over and over again because the quest dungeons never change and you dont want to miss out on the extra XP because this will be your limiting factor after lvl 20

Everything else seems fine to me for an Early Access Game. I played it for about 4-5 hours and could finish the Game (all upgrades /lvl 32) in 1 more hour. So you get about 1hr of Gametime per buck which is a realy good deal. Plus you can play freemode without quest and random generated dungeons to see how far you can go.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In it's current state, I can definitely recommend it.
I mean, c'mon...for the price of a Wendonaldby's fast-food meal, I've had almost 6 hours of entertaining and addictive gameplay.  I've done all the available quests but still have a few more levels to unlock, so it does have a decent amount of replayability already.

Normally I'm very wary of early access games in general, but 2 things about this one:
1. Got it in a bundle for a few bucks.
2. Is more complete than many games that graduate from early access to full release.

As for the reviewer that mentioned something something grind blah blah... I very quickly (maybe <2 hours played) had more than enough gold/crafting materials than I could even use.  If I had one complaint right now, it'd be that it's almost too easy to gain the resources needed for upgrades.

There's a ton of potential here.  Could really be something great if the dev takes into consideration some of the suggestions on the forum.

So yeah, go ahead and get your gross burger and old stale french fries and regret it later when you need to run to the toilet.
OR, get this.  Cause you won't regret this!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Summary: Real time party based dungeon crawl
Multiplayer: No
Completion: 5 hrs
Cards: No
Cloud: Yes

Super Dungeon Run was a rather fascinating experience. It's rare for roguelikes to feature entire parties these days, and SDR takes that up to eleven by allowing you to gather 20 allies at once (or more if you find and free them) and wander around with your lynch mob to stomp over the opposition. It's a chaotic game, and easy to jump in and start whacking away at things.

Super Dungeon Run is a realtime isometric dungeon crawler. I'm not exactly sure if the game uses procedural generation. At the very least quest floors are all the same, but I haven't really noticed any other floors repeating. Combat is nice and simple. Merely move your men in the vicinity of an enemy and they will gang up to beat the poor sobs. Two units cannot occupy the same space, so it is recommended to bring some ranged classes along to maximize damage.

The party structure in the game takes some getting used to. Classes you hire are not automatically a part of your party. To actually make use of classes, you must find them in chests, which upgrades one of your peasants. I like that you can occasionally free a prisoner and add him to your party, which helps offset a bad room that nearly wiped the party.

The loot system is a bit odd. There's no equipment in chests. Instead you may find potions, crafting materials, class upgrades, or cash. Completing a floor quickly while grabbing all the coins and killing all the enemies will net you better rewards at the end of the floor. The crafting materials are used to upgrade your class equipment, which affects all units of that particular class. The drop rate isn't too bad and doesn't require an excessive amount of grinding.

At this time the game balance is a bit out of whack. Early on it is difficult as you have a small party with low levels. But a few upgrades turns that all around and makes floors significantly easier. By the end of the game enemies were nothing more than a nuisance. While there's a fair amount of enemy variety, they are all definitely susceptible to simply being mobbed. If there were some enemies immune to ranged or melee, that could help spice things up a bit. Huge bosses with aoe attacks could also be fun. Maybe some enemies who uses status effects such as poison or charm that can only be countered by a cleric would be nice to have around.

Traps are highly lethal in this game. As your party grows in size, it becomes very clumsy as your death blob moves around haphazardly trying to follow your mouse cursor. Otherwise easily avoided traps become meat grinders because your poor men do not know how to move intelligently or one at a time. It's not always easy to spot traps in time either, such as flaming traps firing from a south wall. If there's one class I would like to see in the game it's a rogue to disable traps because boy those traps kill.

This is the first game I've seen where a mere table can kill you by doing nothing. It manages this by blocking a path, so your troops may end up getting stuck and left behind. I've had a few rooms where I had to walk at snails pace trying to get everyone to avoid walking into a table. I would have liked the ability to change formations, such as single file, because rooms such as these, or traps you must walk around are among the most lethal in the game.

The graphics are pretty good. They are very clear, and show no slowdown, and the animations are fun to look at. For being early access there's a surprising amount of polish here. The music is is also good, though I would have liked a few more songs, as they get repeated often. I haven't noticed any bugs, so good job on that front.

The game doesn't exactly end as best I can tell. Once you've hit max level and finished the last quest, nothing new opens up. I can't help but want that last bit of closure. Thus I judged the end of the game to be max level and completing all quests, which all in all takes about 5 hours. Even though Super Dungeon Run is still considered in early access, in it's current state it's entirely enjoyable. Even the base price is quite reasonable for what you get. I give Super Dungeon Run a 8/10. It's unfinished, but you can definitely see the potential they've got going.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What an hilariously fun little game.

It's extremely simple, and thanks to that easy to get into and enjoy. The Artwork is cute and fun, and the music adventurous and whimsical.

You simply click and hold the left mouse button to guide your mob of peasants on their adventures. Note, they really really aren't adventurers. They're peasants, they want to smash things and get loot, but are really really dumb. They'll often run into spikes and other nasty traps because they saw a vase they want to smash or some coins they want to pick up.

As such they can get all over the place as you increase your party in size. Thankfully you can upgrade them via outfits to transform them into pseudo-adventurers that are better armed than our yellow poncho clothed club swinging ones.

Not only that, but the peasant garb, and unlocked outfits can be upgraded and improved upon.

So head to your tavern, pick up a quest and click Dungeon to get started. The game is is time trial based, so the quicker you do things and better rewards you get. Although in many cases some quest rewards are so lucrative you really don't need to scrounge around wasting time smashing crates or looking for coins. Just rush through. Now while this does mean you miss out on bonus rewards and goodies, you can upgrade the Quest Rewards with level points. Further making them an even better option.


Sadly the dungeons aren't very random, and you can often get the same routes over and over. I do hope they add some procedurally generated versions, along with more quests.

So far it's fun, and considering the price it's well worth it in my opinion.

PC Gameplay
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7JgIMddTc60

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I find my units die most often from an unspoken pyromaniac laced love then anything else, though the archers do love a good arrow to the face.


In all seriousness this game is adorable. It is already well polished and extremely playable. The premise is simple, you're helping a group of dimwitted gold obsessed peasants navigate a dungeon to get all the loot. You use your left mouse and move them around herd style. You can unlock additional character classes via the town which then have a chance of discovering in a dungeon run via costumes in chests. The art style is cute, the animation is adorable and while I sometimes would lose half my party due to drift when I had to take a sharp corner, I never felt like the game was being unfair or cheating me in any way.

The game is more than reasonable at its current price and I look forward to seeing what other additional content the developers put in between now and official release.

10/10 would accidentally steer my group of cosplaying peasants into a spiked barrel again.

First run:  Barrel bomb knocks all my guys into a fire, game over
Second run:  Black spots on the ground mean spikes, game over
Third run:  I got this!  Surprise flame thrower on the wall as I turn the corner, game over
Fourth run: Two cannons in the room with eight mobs, just about to kill last mob, both cannons hit, game over.
Fifth thru Thirtieth runs, much the same.

Normally I would have either chucked my computer out the window or contemplated what Ive done with my life having died so much in a game, but, somehow watching those little poncho wearing toe heads become warriors, archers and other bad â™¥â™¥â™¥ fighters, even while dying in more horrible ways than a Final Destination movie, is oddly relaxing.

For an early access game this is a very well made game so far.  Well done to everyone who is developing it!  Please keep up the great work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very polished fast little roguelike.  The game is fun, and it is great to beat quests or watch your little minions die.

There are a few things that could be better.  In the game traps are way more deadly than monsters.  The designers clearly know this because some of the later levels are really trap heavy.  The monster variety is at best OK, and there are no powerful bosses to defeat, sometimes just rooms with more enemies.

As you get more peasants to your party and level them up, combat against the weak enemies becomes easier, but the giant blob gets harder and harder to avoid traps.  So, while traps start out hard, they become very very hard, and while monsters start out maybe average in difficulty, they become very very easy.

There is a crafting mechanic, but I found that I always had so many resources that I would craft all items as soon as they were unlocked.  Armor upgrades and level upgrades make your guys a little tougher, which offers a little help against traps.  Also, going into the dungeon without selecting a quest and I found the difficulty of the floors could ramp up quite high.

There are only two different looks to the dungeons.  Still the game is very fun and pulls you along.  Once you have maxed out your levels and unlocked everything there is not much else to do, but getting to that point will only take you a few hours.

There is more good than bad about this game, and it is still early access so more improvements to come.  I recommend buying this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really love this game, but honestly there are some things that get me very frustrated... first off is the control speed of the villagers... WAY to fast... I am constantly running into things and my villagers get left behind and I have to run back and grab them, which takes time off my level completion and I get a bad rating at the end of the level. so in all fairness you should reduce the speed a bit so you have a more fairer of a chance. Also another point I would like to make out is the fact that when I am running so fast, I end up running into a fire pit and all my men die...  now honestly how is that enjoyable?

Also I find it very frustrating that because they move so fast I also find it hard to hit the pots and crates because there moving all around so fast in so many different directions. On another note I would like to add that trying to complete the level as fast as the default time is set for is a bit unfair considering I cant rush to break all the barrels and crates and again keep track of and control my people and then rush to find the exit all in 55 secs or whatever and fail the level and only get 2 stars... that needs to be increased by like a min for all levels and runs because it was a miracle when I was able to get 3 stars considering, Again Im not going to be able to enjoy the game if I cant take my time or at the very least not have to feel rushed and then i miss things and get frustrated because of it.

Alright so overall the games amazing, literally been playing it for a while now, and On a more positive note.. the games interface and gameplay is very much enjoyable. I enjoy the enemies and the crafting system and grinding system as well. this is defiantly a game for the price that I would recommend, dispite my negetive comments about the game. this game plays out very well and just needs to be tweaked a bit, perhaps the ability to add in a little bit of magic, some new spells would work out great for this game. my last suggestion would be to have some type of Co op mode because this game should be also playable with friends, also some in game voice chat would be awesome too!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, for less than five bucks, this is an insanely good deal.

There's a lot of depth through upgrades, skillpoints, and leveling. The little minions you have are clumbsy but fun to lead around, often at their peril.

I really think this game would be a good deal at $15, like many other indie games of this style. Being so cheap, I kind of expexted it to not be as good as it actually is.

Great fun, great idea, great buy.

--UPDATE--

After playing for another hour, I am even more in love with this game. I've unlocked new unit types, potions, unit upgrades for weapons and armou. I've also unlocked a couple new quests, which open up new dungeon types.

This game's sweet!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Super Dungeon Run is a roguelike as I have not seen it. It looks really good, in some places already really unfair and provides enough progress to entertain long.

Pros & Cons
+ Great graphics
+ Much Progress
+ Challenges in terms of gold medals
+ Crafting / improvement of your Minions
+ Short Dungeon Runs for the Main Quests" 5-8mins

- Unbalanced Foes and Traps
- Less options
- Intelligence of the Minions is a torment

The game is just like it's been good enough for the price

but unfortunately develops because the cons not really the game .... examples:

So it is with the intelligence of the Minions .... them is more important to break a vase as kill the enemy is hitting them. Equally difficult is it your people hold together .... since i wish me either or ..... Either the Minions decide about everything and I give to you the way .... or I can completely control without their own will. ...

As a last resort are still the options .... I would wish many more options .... eg. Windowed mode

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It looked promising in the beginning, but there is only quiet surrounding the development of this game.

It is a point and click action rpg where you control a whole bunch of guys and run em through a dungeon. This game just needs more depth to it. As it is now, I would say its great for young kids, however the charm and novelty of this game wears off quickly for adults.

Hope this project isn't dead and something happens with this.

I would not recommend this however unless there is some updates in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fun little dungeon crawling romp. I enjoyed my time with it so far. You get to delve into a randomly generated dungeon, go through several floors, and make it to your destination. You unlock more classes, upgrades, and missions as you play. The basics are solid and it has an addictive quality to it that brings you back for more.

Unfortunately, it also leaves you wanting more. I know it is in early access and I really hope they add more depth to it. I would love more customizability, more classes, better control of your squad, possibly taking control of one at a time for short durations so I can get some of the hard to reach gold without demolishing my squad. I would also love to see some more loot, the ability to equip individual soldiers, maybe even some kind of funny story. I just think it needs more before full release.

At the price of $5 it really is worth it, though.

3/5 in current state

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been enjoying playing this game as it is fast and alot of things to kill but there are some improvements needing to be done i know it is only a BETA/Early acess game the things i had in mind to make the game a little bit better were to add a story so there is more of a meaning than just running in and out of dungeons collecting things as i think it would make the game more interesting and exciting i did find out there was quests but i would like something alot bigger i also thoughtt the village was a bit dissapointing since i was hoping to be able to walk around it and go inside the Tavern and etc getting quests from some locals so i think being able to walk around the village and go inside buildings would make the game a bit more cooler the thing that bugged me the most was the pointer it just doesn't look like it belongs in the game just a normal mouse pointer in a dungeon game they could have made it look a bit more cooler like having a wooden or stone cursor with cracks or metal around it making it look more fitting into the game overall the game is fine it's fastr as i've said but everytime you go to slow it just says to slow i thought this was just a lazy way of not adding in good things instead they could have just said best time;your time e.g 1:05.

I played this game at Dundee which i enjoyed but now that i have it as my games i am now looking and thinking of better ways for some things i do have more thoughts on my mimd to what could be added but i think i haved said to much and i am now going  to talk about the good things which i think are a good ideas that are in the game.

1)Levels
2)Traps as it makes the game more harder
3)locked doors leading to enemies or traps making it challenging to get a good time in game
4)Quests
5)Money so you can buy upgrades for you're character.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

i love this game especially the art style and how addictive it is

i recommend this game to people who like fast paced rpg like games and games that are fun and cute.

the good side to this style of game is

1. the cute 2d characters and the 3d background/playing area is great art style and is good for people who dont have top of the line gaming pcs.

2. the game interfaces are simple and easy to learn and not confusing.

3. it is simple and fun to play.

there are little to none bad parts about the game but in my opinion these are the bad things

1. the people slide around too much so its hard to navigate around traps/hallways/none destructable obstacles.

2. the click to move control is slightly annoying and but is a good idea.

3. how most traps are insta kills or there are like 3 traps back to back

but besides the bad parts this game is my faverite game and i am looking forward to what the developer(s) are going to do to this game in the future

i give this game a rating of 5/5 just cause its so fun and beautiful for how simple of a game its just such a lovely game

i also love the power of knowing you control if the dungeon crawlers die heroically fighting a monster or by accidently walking into a trap""

Early Access Review

Fast paced sprint through deathtrap dungeons to complete missions and gather loot. The loot is spent on unlocking new classes and gear in a very superficial and linear fashion. Very arcade in feel but delightfully charming!!

A very fun and enjoyable game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For anyone stumbling across this game within the depths of Steam, do not buy.

This project is dead, the forums are dead, the dev that had been updating the game is no longer a part of Proper Games, and thus no longer works on the game. It's unclear if someone else was supposed to take over, but no one ever did and the game now sits in limbo. Avoid this.
